title: Update production-per-year copy from 24000 MT to 6000 MT across site

requirements.summary: Change the centralized annual production value from “24000 MT” to “6000 MT” and ensure all rendered locations reflect the update, with a repo-wide guard against the legacy string.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/siteContent.ts` has `about.productionPerYear` set to exactly `6000 MT` (replacing `24000 MT`).
Home page stats section displays `6000 MT` for “Production Per Year”.
About page body text and About page stats display `6000 MT` for annual production/production capacity.
A repo-wide check confirms there are no remaining user-facing occurrences of the exact string `24000 MT`.

file_operations.description: Update `siteContent.about.productionPerYear` from `24000 MT` to exactly `6000 MT` so all pages consuming centralized content (including Home stats and About text/stats) render the corrected value.

Add a lightweight repo-wide check script that scans frontend source content for the exact legacy string `24000 MT` and fails with a non-zero exit code if found, to support the required verification step.
Add an npm script (e.g., `check:legacy-strings`) that runs the frontend legacy-string scan so the repo-wide check for `24000 MT` is easy and repeatable.
